  "description": "Dunn And Braxton Limited -&nbsp;Our client is a dynamic and fast-growing company specializing in the wholesale distribution of premium tobacco accessories. With operational hubs in Lagos, Enugu, and Abuja, they are expanding aggressively across Nigeria and beyond.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Support Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

Summary


	The company is seeking to hire an Operations Support Officer who will ensures seamless daily operations by coordinating workflows, supporting cross-functional teams, and ensuring efficient processes across logistics, warehouse, inventory, and customer service functions.
	This role is key to sustaining operational excellence as we scale.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor and support order fulfillment, shipping, and delivery processes.
	Maintain operational calendars and coordinate with logistics and warehouse teams.
	Support implementation of SOPs across branches for process consistency.
	Identify inefficiencies and propose solutions for streamlining workflows.
	Assist in setting up new branches, infrastructure, and tools to enhance productivity.
	Support system audits and compliance tracking.
	Track KPIs across supply chain and operations.
	Prepare reports and dashboards for management review.
	Maintain documentation for operational procedures, incident reports, and service logs.
	Act as a liaison between operations, finance, sales, and customer service teams.
	Assist in vendor and service provider management.


Key Requirements


	Good First Degree in Human Resource, Business Administration, or related field.
	2+ years of experience in operations, logistics, or admin roles (FMCG or retail preferred).
	Highly organized, tech-savvy, and detail-oriented.
	Strong analytical and communication skills.
	Proficiency with Microsoft Office and cloud collaboration tools.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-location environment.


Compensation
N150,000 monthly net + Other benefits.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;recruitment@dunnandbraxton.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Operations Support Officer&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

Operations Support Officer Job at Dunn And Braxton Limited




        
    

        
        Dunn And Braxton Limited - Our client is a dynamic and fast-growing company specializing in the wholesale distribution of premium tobacco accessories. With operational hubs in Lagos, Enugu, and Abuja, they are expanding aggressively across Nigeria and beyond.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Support Officer

Job Location: Ikota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Onsite)

Summary
     

            
    




	The company is seeking to hire an Operations Support Officer who will ensures seamless daily operations by coordinating workflows, supporting cross-functional teams, and ensuring efficient processes across logistics, warehouse, inventory, and customer service functions.
	This role is key to sustaining operational excellence as we scale.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor and support order fulfillment, shipping, and delivery processes.
	Maintain operational calendars and coordinate with logistics and warehouse teams.
	Support implementation of SOPs across branches for process consistency.
	Identify inefficiencies and propose solutions for streamlining workflows.
	Assist in setting up new branches, infrastructure, and tools to enhance productivity.
	Support system audits and compliance tracking.
	Track KPIs across supply chain and operations.
	Prepare reports and dashboards for management review.
	Maintain documentation for operational procedures, incident reports, and service logs.
	Act as a liaison between operations, finance, sales, and customer service teams.
	Assist in vendor and service provider management.


Key Requirements


	Good First Degree in Human Resource, Business Administration, or related field.
	2+ years of experience in operations, logistics, or admin roles (FMCG or retail preferred).
	Highly organized, tech-savvy, and detail-oriented.
	Strong analytical and communication skills.
	Proficiency with Microsoft Office and cloud collaboration tools.
	Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, multi-location environment.


Compensation
N150,000 monthly net + Other benefits.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: recruitment@dunnandbraxton.com using “Operations Support Officer” as the subject of the mail.

Assistant Sales Manager Job at Affordable Cars Limited




        
    

        
        Affordable Cars Limited - We are a fast growing Auto dealer in Lagos, Nigeria, serving our unique and discerning clientele since 1995. Our brands include Toyota, Honda, Lexus, Land Rover, KIA, Mitsubishi, Mercedes Benz, Nissan, Infiniti, Ford, etc. Our customer base includes Corporate Organizations, Government Parastatals and Private Individuals. Our vehicles are covered with manufacturer’s warranty. We also run an automobile workshop called AutoCare 24/7, where vehicles are given best of repairs and after sales maintenance.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Sales Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

            
    



Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree obtained from a reputable institution.
	Relevant experience: A minimum of 4 - 7 years of professional experience, with at least 3 years at a managerial level, specifically within Lagos.
	Excellent communication / presentation, negotiation, persuasion, and team management skills
	Strong customer service and relationship-building skills
	Ability to meet or exceed personal and collective sales targets.
	Ability to design sales plan and follow up its implementation
	Ability to drive. Possess valid driver's license.
	Familiarity with digital/ social media marketing.
	?Living in Lekki, or the Island part of Lagos. Location requirement is important.
	Candidates must not be more than 37 years of age.


Salary Range
Negotiable.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their Resume to: careers@affordablecarsng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	All CVs must include addresses and date of birth.
	Only qualified candidates will be invited for interview.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Assistant",
  "description": "TheHRHive - Our client, an Event Management Company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We seek a highly skilled, proactive Executive Assistant (EA) to the CEO to provide high-level administrative and operational support.
	This role ensures smooth operation of the CEO&#39;s office, optimizes efficiency, and supports strategic priorities.
	The EA will manage calendars, communications, stakeholder engagement,record-keeping,basic compliance filings (e.g., CAC/tax), and project coordination.
	The ideal candidate has strong research capabilities to support informed decision-making.


Key Responsibilities
Executive Office &amp; Administrative Support:


	Manage CEO&rsquo;s calendar, schedule meetings, and coordinateevent logistics
	Handle email/calls, ensuring&lt;24-hour response time
	Prepare reports, presentations, and strategic briefs.
	Document meeting minutes, track action items, and ensure100% closure
	Maintain records, contracts, and organized document systems.
	Process purchase orders (POs), track invoices, and manage receipts


Strategic &amp; Operational Support:


	Track projects usingAsana, Notion, or G-Suiteto monitor action items for events, branding, and finance.
	Assist with strategic projects and partnerships.
	Conduct research and data analysis.
	Draft/review internal policies and agreements.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	Coordinate communication between the CEO andCEO, COO, and key stakeholders.
	Draft/distribute stakeholder reports and documentation.
	Support external communication strategies.


Confidentiality &amp; Risk Management:


	Maintain confidentiality of executive matters.
	Enforce data protection protocols.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree.
